Dgame.Window.Window



class Window;
Window is a rendering window where all drawable objects are drawn.

Note that the default clear-color is Color.White and the default Sync is Window.Sync.Enable.

Author:
rschuett

enum Sync: int;
The Window syncronisation mode. Default Syncronisation is Sync.Enable.

Enable
Sync is enabled

Disable
Sync is disabled

LateSwapTearing
For late swap tearing

enum Style: int;
The specific window styles

Fullscreen
Window is fullscreened

Desktop
Desktop Fullscreen

OpenGL
OpenGL support

Shown
Show the Window immediately

Borderless
Hide the Window immediately

Resizeable
Window is resizeable

Maximized
Maximize the Window immediately

Minimized
Minimize the Window immediately

InputGrabbed
Grab the input inside the window

InputFocus
The Window has input (keyboard) focus

MouseFocus
The Window has mouse focus

Default
Default mode is Shown | OpenGL

final this(VideoMode videoMode, string title = DefaultTitle, Style style = Window.Style.Default, short x = DefaultXPos, short y = DefaultYPos);
CTor

final void close();
Close and destroy this window.

static int count();
Returns how many windows exist

final @property uint id();
Every window has an unique Id. This method returns this Id.

final const bool useVerticalSync(Sync sync);
Set the Syncronisation mode of this window. Default Syncronisation is Sync.Enable.

See:
Sync enum

Returns if the sync mode is supported.

final Sync getVerticalSync();
Returns the current syncronisation mode.

See:
Sync enum

final const pure nothrow Style getStyle();
Returns the Window Style.

See:
Style enum

final const Surface capture(Texture.Format fmt = Texture.Format.BGRA);
Capture the pixel data of the current window and returns a Surface with this pixel data. You can also alter the format of the pixel data. Default is Texture.Format.BGRA. This method is predestinated for screenshots.

Example:
Window wnd = ...
...
wnd.capture().saveToFile("samples/img/screenshot.png");


If you want to use the Screenshot more than only to save it, it could be better to wrap it into an Image.

Example:
Window wnd = ...
...
Image screen = new Image(wnd.capture());


final const bool hasKeyboardFocus();
Returns if the keyboard focus is on this window.

final const bool hasMouseFocus();
Returns if the mouse focus is on this window.

final pure nothrow void setFpsLimit(ubyte fps);
Set the framerate limit for this window.

final const pure nothrow ubyte getFpsLimit();
Returns the framerate limit for this window.

final const pure nothrow @property bool isOpen();
Check if this window is still opened.

final void setClearColor(ref const Color col);
Set the color with which this windows clear his buffer. This is also the background color of the window.

final void setClearColor(const Color col);
Rvalue version

final void setClearColor(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha = 0.000000);
Set the color with which this windows clear his buffer. This is also the background color of the window.

final const void clear();
Clears the buffer.

final const void draw(Drawable draw);
Draw a drawable object on screen.

final const void draw(Renderer rtarget);
Draw a Renderer on the screen.

final void display();
Make all changes visible on screen. If the framerate limit is not 0, it waits for (1000 / framerate limit) milliseconds.

final void setPosition(short x, short y);
Set a new position to this window

final void setPosition(ref const Vector2s vec);
Set a new position to this window

final Vector2s getPosition();
Returns the current position of the window.

final void fetchPosition(int* x, int* y);
Fetch the current position if this window. The position is stored inside of the pointer. The pointer don't have to be null.

final const pure nothrow string getTitle();
Returns the current title of the window.

final const(string) setTitle(const string title);
Set a new title to this window

Returns:
the old title

final void setSize(ushort width, ushort height);
Set a new size to this window

final void raise();
Raise the window. The window has after this call focus.

final void restore();
Restore the window.

final void setScreenSaver(bool enable);
Enable or Disable the screen saver.

final const bool isScreenSaverEnabled();
Returns if the screen saver is currently enabled, or not.

final void show(bool show);
Show or hide the window. true shows, false hides.

final void setGrabbed(bool enable);
When input is grabbed the mouse is confined to the window.

final bool isGrabbed();
Returns true, if input is grabbed.

final float getBrightness();
Returns the brightness (gamma correction) for the window where 0.0 is completely dark and 1.0 is normal brightness.

final bool setBrightness(float bright);
Set the brightness (gamma correction) for the window.

final void setFullscreen(uint style);
Use this function to set a window's fullscreen state. style may be Style.Fullscreen for "real" fullscreen with a videomode change or Style.Desktop for "fake" fullscreen that takes the size of the desktop 0 for windowed mode.

final const pure nothrow bool isFullscreen();
Returns, if this Window is in fullscreen mode.

final void setIcon(ref Surface icon);
Set an icon for this window.

final void setIcon(Surface icon);
Rvalue version
